sentences.en: A bare recital of the novel's themes gives no idea of its skill.
sentences.cn: 不过光谈这部小说的主题,还不足以看出它的技巧的高明.

sentences.en: Before long we all grew bored with his frequent recital of the foods he couldn't eat.
sentences.cn: 他总是唠叨自己不能吃的那些食物，不久我们所有人都听烦了。

sentences.en: He gave us a recital of his experiences.
sentences.cn: 他向我们详细讲述了他的经历.

sentences.en: Her recital led off / She led off her recital with a Haydn sonata.
sentences.cn: 她在独奏会上首先演出的是海顿的奏鸣曲.

sentences.en: I had their total attention during the thirty-five minutes that my recital took.
sentences.cn: 在我叙述的35分钟内，他们完全被我吸引了。

sentences.en: Mr Ashkenazy has informed us that he will be unable to honour his contract with Symphony Hall to perform the piano recital.
sentences.cn: 阿什克纳齐先生已通知我们，他将无法履行和交响音乐厅签订的钢琴独奏演出合同。

sentences.en: She gave us a boring recital of all her troubles.
sentences.cn: 她乏味地向我们详述了她所有的麻烦.

sentences.en: She is going to give a piano recital.
sentences.cn: 她即将举行钢琴独奏会.

sentences.en: She repeated the waltz as an encore, eg at a piano recital.
sentences.cn: 她应听众的要求把华尔兹舞曲又演奏了一遍(如在钢琴独奏会上).

sentences.en: The hoarse tenor singer mucked up the recital.
sentences.cn: 沙哑的男高音把音乐会搞砸了.

sentences.en: The recital was succinct and impressive.
sentences.cn: 这一席谈话简明扼要,给人以深刻印象.

sentences.en: This rather bloodcurdling recital , delivered with the usual Achesonian aplomb, startled the British.
sentences.cn: 这种颇有点令人毛骨悚然的议论, 以艾奇逊式一贯的沉着自若的腔调发表出来, 使英国人为之骇然.

sentences.en: To dissipate the sadness of this recital, Tess went and bade all her favourite cows good - bye.
sentences.cn: 苔丝听了这些故事,自然很伤感,她想把悲哀排遣, 就去外面,向她从前喜欢的那些牛告别.

sentences.en: Your very effective recital of British war effort will greatly impress world public opinion.
sentences.cn: 你对于英国在大战中的努力作了很精辟的报告,这将使世界舆论得到深刻的印象.

trans.tran_cn: 独唱会，独奏会，小型音乐会、舞蹈表演会等，一系列事件等的详述
trans.tran_en: a performance of music or poetry, usually given by one performer
